Core¶

Defaults¶

class pyrai.api.Defaults¶

Class used to set default values for various parameters used by the API.

Defaults.BASE_URL: Defaults = "https://api.routable.ai"¶
Defaults.VISUALIZATION_URL: Defaults = "https://dashboard.routable.ai/pyraimap?start={start}&end={end}&api_key={api_key}&fleet_key={fleet_key}"¶

Pyrai¶

class pyrai.api.Pyrai(url='https://api.routable.ai', api_key=None)¶

Class used to connect to API with API key (no fleet key).

api_key¶

The API key. Defaults to None.

Type

str

base_url¶

The url of the API service. Defaults to “https://api.routable.ai/”

Type

str

build_url(endpoint)¶

Builds a URL given an endpoint

Parameters

(Endpoint (endpoint) – str): The endpoint to build the URL for

Returns

The URL to access the given API endpoint

Return type

str

create_live_fleet(max_wait='3m', max_delay='6m', unlocked_window='2m', close_pickup_window='1s')¶

Creates a new live fleet.

Parameters

  • max_wait (str, optional) – The max wait time. Defaults to “3m”.

  • max_delay (str, optional) – The max delay time. Defaults to “6m”.

  • unlocked_window (str, optional) – The unlocked window time. Defaults to “2m”.

  • close_pickup_window (str, optional) – The close pickup window time. Defaults to “1s”.

Returns

The newly created fleet, if successful.

Return type

Fleet

Raises

StatusError – If the API call does not return a 200 response.

create_sim_fleet(max_wait='3m', max_delay='6m', unlocked_window='2m', close_pickup_window='1s')¶

Creates a new simulation fleet.

Parameters

  • max_wait (str, optional) – The max wait time. Defaults to “3m”.

  • max_delay (str, optional) – The max delay time. Defaults to “6m”.

  • unlocked_window (str, optional) – The unlocked window time. Defaults to “2m”.

  • close_pickup_window (str, optional) – The close pickup window time. Defaults to “1s”.

Returns

The newly created fleet, if successful.

Return type

Fleet

Raises

StatusError – If the API call does not return a 200 response.

todict()¶

Converts the Pyrai object to a python dictionary.

Returns

A dictionary representation of self.

Return type

dict

Fleets¶

class pyrai.api.Fleet(fleet_key, params=<pyrai.api.FleetParams object>, api_key=None, pyrai=None, vis_url='https://dashboard.routable.ai/pyraimap?start={start}&end={end}&api_key={api_key}&fleet_key={fleet_key}', base_url='https://api.routable.ai')¶

Class used to represent a fleet. All vehicle, request, and assignment API calls are methods of this class.

pyrai¶

The Pyrai object this fleet was built from.

Type

string

fleet_key¶

The fleet key corresponding to this fleet.

Type

string

api_key¶

The API key corresponding to this fleet.

Type

string

params¶

The parameters of this fleet.

Type

FleetParams

vis_url¶

The URL used for visualizations.

Type

string

add_request(rid, pickup, dropoff, load, request_time=datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 10, 20, 57, 40890))¶

Attempts to add a request.

Parameters

  • rid (int) – The unique request ID.

  • pickup (Location) – The pickup location.

  • dropoff (Location) – The dropoff location.

  • load (int) – The load (number of passengers).

  • request_time (datetime.datetime, optional) – Time of the request. This may be in the future for scheduled pickups. Defaults to datetime.datetime.now().

Returns

If successful.

Return type

StatusResponse

Raises

StatusError – If unsuccessful.

Builds a URL given an endpoint.

Parameters

(Endpoint (endpoint) – str): The endpoint to build the URL for.

Returns

The URL to access the given API endpoint.

Return type

str

cancel_request(rid, event_time=datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 10, 20, 57, 40891))¶

Attempts to cancel a request.

Parameters

  • rid (int) – The unique request ID

  • event_time (datetime.datetime, optional) – Time of the cancellation. Defaults to datetime.datetime.now().

Raises

StatusError – If unsuccessful.

Returns

If the request is sucessfully cancelled.

Return type

Status Response

plot_metrics(metrics, start_time, end_time)¶

Plots time series metrics.

Parameters

  • metrics (list[Metrics]) – A list of metrics to plot.

  • start_time (datetime.datetime or str) – The start time, either as a datetime.datetime object or an ISO string.

  • end_time (datetime.datetime or str) – The end time, either as a datetime.datetime object or an ISO string.

Returns

A figure that graphs the metrics

over the time interval.

Return type

Plotly.Figure

remove_vehicle(vid, location)¶

Attempts to remove a vehicle.

Parameters

  • vid (int) – The unique vehicle ID.

  • location (Location) – The vehicle Location.

Returns

If vehicle is successfully removed, returns

a list of IDs of passengers of the vehicle.

list[int]

Raises

StatusError – If unsuccessful.

set_params(max_wait=None, max_delay=None, unlocked_window=None, close_pickup_window=None)¶

Mutates the fleet object and sets the provided params.

Parameters

  • max_wait (str, optional) – The max wait time. Defaults to None.

  • max_delay (str, optional) – The max delay time. Defaults to None.

  • unlocked_window (str, optional) – The unlocked window time. Defaults to None.

  • close_pickup_window (str, optional) – The close pickup window time. Defaults to None.

Returns

If successful.

Return type

StatusResponse

Raises

StatusError – If unsuccessful.

todict()¶

Converts the Fleet object into a python dictionary. Note that this does not contain all attributes.

Returns

A dictionary representation of self.

Return type

dict

update_vehicle(vid, location, event, direction=0, event_time=datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 10, 20, 57, 40882), req_id=None)¶

Attempts to update a vehicle.

Parameters

  • vid (int) – The unique vehicle ID

  • location (Location) – The vehicle location.

  • direction (float) – Angle in radians clockwise away from true north

  • event (VehicleEvent) – Describes the current event for the vehicle. pickup occurs when the vehicle has picked up a request. dropoff occurs when the vehicle has dropped of a request. progress should be set when the vehicle is moving to service a request, either picking up or dropping off. The vehicle should be marked as unassigned when it is is not assigned to any requests.

  • event_time (datetime.datetime, optional) – Time at which the vehicle update has occurred. Defaults to datetime.datetime.now().

  • req_id (int, optional) – The unique ID of request the vehicle is servicing. If the vehicle is unassigned, this may be omitted. Defaults to None.

Returns

If successful.

Return type

Vehicle

Raises

StatusError – If unsucessful.

property user_key¶

UserKey object corresponding to the fleet.

Type

UserKey

visualize(start_time, end_time)¶

Visualizes the fleet for the given time frame.

Parameters

  • start_time (datetime.datetime or str) – The start time, either as a datetime.datetime object or an ISO string.

  • end_time (datetime.datetime or str) – The end time, either as a datetime.datetime object or an ISO string.

Returns

A graphic view of the fleet through time.

Return type

IFrame

Class used to represent vehicles.

Type

Fleet

veh_id¶

the unique ID of the vehicle.

Type

int

location¶

the location of the vehicle.

Type

Locaiton

assigned¶

True if vehicle is assigned, false if not.

Type

boolean

req_ids¶

list of request IDs of assigned requests.

Type

list[int]

events¶

list of events this vehicle is assigned to.

Type

list[Event]

static fromdict(fleet, d)¶

Converts a python dictionary into a Vehicle object.

Parameters

  • fleet (Fleet) – The fleet the vehicle is part of.

  • d (dict) – The dictionary with the vehicle parameters.

Returns

A vehicle object with the parameters the dictionary specifes.

Return type

Vehicle

make_online(location=None, capacity=6)¶

Makes vehicle online.

Parameters

  • location (Lovation, optional) – Location of vehicle, uses self.location if nothing is provided. Defaults to None.

  • capacity (int, optional) – The capacity of the vehicle. Defaults to Defaults.DEFAULT_CAPACITY.

Returns

If successful.

StatusResponse

Removes the vehicle.

Parameters

location (Location, optional) – The location of the vehicle, will be set to self.location if nothing is provided. Defaults to None.

If successful.

Return type

dict

update(event, req_id=None, location=None, direction=0, event_time=datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 8, 10, 20, 57, 40913))¶

Updates the vehicle. Note that this mutates the vehicle, so nothing is returned.

Parameters

  • location (Location, optional) – The vehicle location, set to self.location if nothing is provided. Defaults to None.

  • direction (float, optional) – Angle in radians clockwise away from true north. Defaults to Defaults.DEFAULT_DIRECTION.

  • event (VehicleEvent) – Describes the current event for the vehicle. pickup occurs when the vehicle has picked up a request. dropoff occurs when the vehicle has dropped of a request. progress should be set when the vehicle is moving to service a request, either picking up or dropping off. The vehicle should be marked as unassigned when it is is not assigned to any requests.

  • event_time (datetime.datetime, optional) – Time at which the vehicle update has occurred. Defaults to datetime.datetime.now().

  • req_id (int, optional) – The unique ID of request the vehicle is servicing. If the vehicle is unassigned, this may be omitted. Defaults to None.

Returns

None

Raises

StatusError – If unsuccessful.

VehicleEvents¶

class pyrai.api.VehicleEvent¶

Describes the current event for a vehicle. PICKUP occurs when the vehicle has picked up a request. DROPOFF occurs when the vehicle has dropped of a request. PROGRESS should be set when the vehicle is moving to service a request, either picking up or dropping off. The vehicle should be marked as UNASSIGNED when it is is not assigned to any requests.

VehicleEvent.PICKUP: VehicleEvent = "pickup"¶
VehicleEvent.DROPOFF: VehicleEvent = "dropoff"¶
VehicleEvent.PROGRESS: VehicleEvent = "progress"¶
VehicleEvent.UNASSIGNED: VehicleEvent = "unassigned"¶

Requests¶

class pyrai.api.Request(fleet, pickup, dropoff, request_time, req_id, veh_id, load, assigned)¶

Class for representing requests.

fleet¶

The fleet that the request is a part of.

Type

Fleet

pickup¶

The pickup location.

Type

Location

dropoff¶

The dropoff location.

Type

Location

request_time¶

The request time.

Type

datetime.datetime

req_id¶

The request ID.

Type

int

veh_id¶

The ID of the Vehicle corresponding to this request. -1 if unassigned.

Type

int

load¶

The load (number of passengers) in this request.

Type

int

assigned¶

True if assigned, false if not.

Type

boolean

class pyrai.api.StatusError(resp=None, status=None, error=None)¶

Metrics¶

class pyrai.api.Metrics¶

Class used to specify the metrics that can be queried.

Metrics.TIME: Metrics = "time"¶
Metrics.PASSENGERS: Metrics = "passengers"¶
Metrics.WAITING_REQUESTS: Metrics = "waiting_requests"¶
Metrics.ACTIVE_REQUESTS: Metrics = "active_requests"¶
Metrics.DROPPED_REQUESTS: Metrics = "dropped_requests"¶
Metrics.CANCELED_REQUESTS: Metrics = "canceled_requests"¶
Metrics.TOTAL_REQUESTS: Metrics = "total_requests"¶
Metrics.ASSIGNED_VEHICLES: Metrics = "assigned_vehicles"¶
Metrics.IDLE_VEHICLES: Metrics = "idle_vehicles"¶
Metrics.REBALANCING_VEHICLES: Metrics = "rebalancing_vehicles"¶
Metrics.OFFLINE_VEHICLES: Metrics = "offline_vehicles"¶
Metrics.AVG_WAIT: Metrics = "avg_wait"¶
Metrics.AVG_DELAY: Metrics = "avg_delay"¶
Metrics.AVG_OCCUPANCY: Metrics = "avg_occupancy"¶
Metrics.SERVICE_RATE: Metrics = "service_rate"¶
